ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'Even if I were to bring you something undeniable?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (Moses) said: "Even though I have brought to you something convincing?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Moses said: "Even if I were to bring a Clear Sign to you?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Moses asked, "What if I were to bring you clear proof (of the existence of God)?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Said Moosa, “Even if I bring to you something clear?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He said: "Even if I bring you something manifest"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: What! even if I bring to you something manifest?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He said, 'What, even though I brought thee something so manifest?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: Even though I show thee something plain?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and Moses asked, "Even if I show you a clear sign?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He said: even though I bring unto thee something manifest?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘What if I bring you something [as an] unmistakable [proof]?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Moses) said: "Even if I showed you something clear (and) convincing?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Musa (Moses) said: "Even if I bring you something manifest (and convincing)?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What, even if I brought you something clear' said he (Moses).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “What if I bring you something convincing?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Moses] said, "Even if I brought you proof manifest?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:30] He, Moses, said, to him: ‘What, would you do this even, if I bring you something manifest?’, patent proof of my Mission?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said) Moses said: (Even though I show thee) Pharaoh (something plain) a sign that serves as proof for what I say?
